course_title: Advanced Topics in Biology - ADV TOPICS BIOL

sections.comments: Course Description: PRODUCTIVITY AND REPRODUCIBILITY IN ECOLOGY AND EVOLUTION This course aims to transform the way that ecologists and evolutionary biologists work: to increase productivity, improve accountability, and meet new requirements for research reproducibility. Trainees will learn how to integrate open science best practices into their individual and collaborative research workflows, and use digital platforms and tools to facilitate collaboration, ensure transparency, enable pre-registrations, and implement version control and provenance trackingPre-requisites"	Graduate-level thesis in Ecology or Evolutionary Biology"	Introductory coding experience or a willingness to learnDelivery format"	8 sessions, 1.5 hours per session"	Each session generally includes a lecture and a hands-on component, of varying length among sessionsFull syllabus: https://osf.io/uwzx5/wiki/Course%20outline/Instructors: Jason Pither, Gavin Simpson, and postdocs from Living Data Project
